body: Charles Armor is known primarily as a Washington, D.C. artist. Little is known of his art training or exhibitions; however, he was quite skilled as the painting above illustratesânote the tromp lâoeil effect of the knife in the foreground. Armor painted mostly still-lifes and landscapes; however, genre scenes and portraits by Armor can be found. The U.S. Department of the Interior has Armorâs work in their museum. He is listed in Davenportâs Art Reference (2005), The artist's Bluebook (L. Pierson, ed., 2005) and Who was Who in American Art (Falk, 1999).
dimensions: Oil on canvas, 7.5 x 9.5 inches / Signed lower right
